Experiment Method.Assay Method: Immunoprecipitation and Western Blotting for Dimer Formation

Material used.Description: Human 293T cells were transfected with expression vectors for FLAG-DJ-1 and HA-DJ-1. Mouse NIH3T3 cell lines harboring FLAG-tagged wild-type or mutant DJ-1 were also used.

Readout description.Result Description: L166P mutant does not form homodimers, only forms heterodimers with wild-type DJ-1 in smaller amounts.
M26I mutant forms both homodimers and heterodimers with wild-type DJ-1.
R98Q mutant forms both homodimers and heterodimers with wild-type DJ-1.
D149A mutant forms both homodimers and heterodimers with wild-type DJ-1.
C106S mutant forms both homodimers and heterodimers with wild-type DJ-1.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type DJ-1 was used as a positive control for dimer formation.

Basic negative control.Description: Non-specific IgG was used as a negative control for immunoprecipitation.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Detection of both homodimer and heterodimer formation with wild-type DJ-1.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Failure to form homodimers or reduced heterodimer formation with wild-type DJ-1.

Material used.Description: Mouse NIH3T3 cell lines harboring FLAG-tagged wild-type or mutant DJ-1 were cultured in the presence or absence of proteasome inhibitor MG132.

Readout description.Result Description: L166P mutant is unstable, with increased stability in the presence of MG132.
M26I mutant is unstable, with increased stability in the presence of MG132.
R98Q mutant is more stable than wild-type DJ-1, with increased stability in the presence of MG132.
D149A mutant is more stable than wild-type DJ-1, with increased stability in the presence of MG132.
C106S mutant stability is not affected by MG132.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type DJ-1 was used as a positive control for stability.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Protein levels comparable to wild-type DJ-1 without significant degradation.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Reduced protein levels compared to wild-type DJ-1, indicating instability or degradation.

Experiment Method.Assay Method: Flow Cytometry for ROS Scavenging Activity

Material used.Description: Mouse NIH3T3 cell lines harboring FLAG-tagged wild-type or mutant DJ-1, and DJ-1-knockdown cells (D2), were treated with DCFH-DA to measure ROS levels.

Readout description.Result Description: L166P mutant shows high fluorescence intensity, indicating little activity for scavenging ROS under no stress and after H2O2 treatment.
M26I mutant shows reduced activity to eliminate exogenously added H2O2.
R98Q mutant shows reduced activity to eliminate exogenously added H2O2.
D149A mutant shows reduced activity to eliminate exogenously added H2O2.
C106S mutant shows high fluorescence intensity, indicating little activity for scavenging ROS under no stress and after H2O2 treatment.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type DJ-1 expressing cells were used as a positive control for ROS scavenging.

Basic negative control.Description: DJ-1-knockdown cells (D2) were used as a negative control for ROS scavenging.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Fluorescence intensity similar to wild-type DJ-1 expressing cells, indicating effective ROS scavenging.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Increased fluorescence intensity compared to wild-type DJ-1 expressing cells, indicating reduced ROS scavenging activity.

Material used.Description: Mouse NIH3T3 cell lines harboring FLAG-tagged wild-type or mutant DJ-1, and DJ-1-knockdown cells (D2), were treated with H2O2 to measure cell viability.

Readout description.Result Description: L166P mutant cells are highly sensitive to H2O2-induced cell death.
M26I mutant cells show increased sensitivity to H2O2-induced cell death, especially at high doses.
R98Q mutant cells show moderate sensitivity to H2O2-induced cell death.
D149A mutant cells are resistant to H2O2-induced cell death, with viability similar to wild-type cells.
C106S mutant cells are highly sensitive to H2O2-induced cell death.

Biological replicates.Description: More than five experiments were carried out.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type DJ-1 expressing cells were used as a positive control for cell viability.

Basic negative control.Description: DJ-1-knockdown cells (D2) were used as a negative control for cell viability.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Cell viability similar to wild-type DJ-1 expressing cells under H2O2 treatment.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Reduced cell viability compared to wild-type DJ-1 expressing cells under H2O2 treatment.
